text:
- At Slack, our mission is to
make people's working lives

simpler, more pleasant,
and more productive.

In this new era, with people
embracing distributed work,
Slack has become their digital HQ,

a place to connect your
people, partners and systems
no matter where you are.

And we've been working closely
with AWS on this for years.
From the start, we built Slack on AWS,

and it's helped us scale to
tens of millions of users.
With powerful machine learning
and real-time communication capabilities,

AWS enabled us to launch
some of our newest

and fastest adopted
features like Slack Huddles
and Slack Clips to help teams embrace
flexible and asynchronous work.

Slack Huddles is a
lightweight audio-first way

of communicating that's built
on the Amazon Chime SDK,

which powers real-time
communication capabilities.
And Slack Clips is a new way to create

and easily share audio,
video and screen recordings
in any channel or DM in Slack.

In fact, this is coming to you
through a Slack Clip today.
It's built on Amazon Transcribe,
which enables real-time language detection
and AWS Elemental MediaConvert
to power rich, async media experiences.

And, of course, at the
center of it all is data.

We use AWS machine
learning and data analytics
to better understand product usage,
fine tune future development,
and inform our product roadmap.
Thanks to AWS, we're helping companies
build their digital HQs for more flexible,
inclusive and connected work.
(text bubbling)
